content.description:
The picture does no justice to how great of a hand / finger crack this is. Just superb jams almost the entire way, with little in the way of face features to assist you. This route will let you know if your crack skills are lacking or not. Short crux section.

Descent:

Rappel from bolts with quick links.
content.protection: Finger to hand sized cams. A single BD #3 (or 4 if you have it) is great for the final moves before the anchor. Two bolt anchor with quick links.
content.location: First obvious, continuous crack right of the squeeze chimney (Quantum Leap).

content.description:
I thought of this route as a little bit of type II fun. It's a squeeze chimney, with lots of grunting, shuffling, and heel-toeing, but also lots of cool arms spread wide double crack side-pull climbing. This would be a bold lead, as you can't really see into either crack as you are climbing.

Descent:

Rappel route from two bolt anchor with quick links.
content.protection: Lots of gear options on right hand wall. Takes gear up to BD#3. Two bolt anchor with quick links.
content.location: The gaping 10" wide squeeze chimney in the corner.
